title: Chevy advertising font
content:
"What the font" says Sommet or Stainless, but neither are exactly right. Sommet's S has different shaped bowls, and Stainless' verticals aren't as straight.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100619085225im_/http:/typophile.com/files/chevy_3955.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [chevy.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20100619085225/http:/typophile.com/files/chevy.png) | 44.14 KB |
author: davidc

comments.content: It was slightly customized for Chevrolet, so that may be what tripped up WTF.
Yes, I see that the center of majuscule M in the Chevy version reaches the baseline, unlike the off-the-shelf version. Thanks!
